TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit BitmapPalette extends System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherObject
Public NotInheritable Class BitmapPalette Inherits DispatcherObject

Docs.summary: Defines the available color palette for a supported image type.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Only [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_tiff](~/includes/tlasharptla-tiff-md.md)] and [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_gif](~/includes/tlasharptla-gif-md.md)] image formats support image palettes. However, other image types can be used to define a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalette>. Attempting to define a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalette> for an unsupported bitmap format does not result in an exception; the designated <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalette> is simply ignored.
[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] supports both custom color palettes and predefined palettes defined by the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalettes> class.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to define a custom <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalette> and apply it to a new <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource>.
[!code-csharp[bitmapframeexample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitmapFrameExample/CSharp/BitmapFrame.cs#1)] [!code-vb[bitmapframeexample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitmapFrameExample/VB/BitmapFrame.vb#1)]
The following example demonstrates how to retrieve a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalette> from an image.
[!code-csharp[bitmapframeexample#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitmapFrameExample/CSharp/BitmapFrame.cs#5)] [!code-vb[bitmapframeexample#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitmapFrameExample/VB/BitmapFrame.vb#5)]

Docs.param: The colors to add to the custom palette.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to define a custom <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalette> and apply it to a new <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource>.
[!code-csharp[bitmapframeexample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitmapFrameExample/CSharp/BitmapFrame.cs#1)] [!code-vb[bitmapframeexample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitmapFrameExample/VB/BitmapFrame.vb#1)]

Docs.exception: The parameter is less than 1 or greater than 256.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource bitmapSource, int32 maxColorCount) cil managed

Docs.param: The source bitmap from which the palette is read or constructed.
The maximum number of colors the new can use.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class based on the specified . The new is limited to a specified maximum color count.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the `bitmapSource` already has a defined palette, the corresponding palette is returned. Otherwise, a new palette is constructed from an analysis of the bitmap.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to retrieve a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalette> from an image.
